item.title: 'Chairmen' of $100 million scam operation extradited to US
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: The U.S. Department of Justice charged four Ghanaian nationals for their roles in a massive fraud ring linked to the theft of over $100 million in romance scams and business email compromise attacks. [...]

item.title: Over 29,000 Exchange servers unpatched against high-severity flaw
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Over 29,000 Exchange servers exposed online remain unpatched against a high-severity vulnerability that can let attackers move laterally in Microsoft cloud environments, potentially leading to complete domain compromise. [...]

item.title: Connex Credit Union data breach impacts 172,000 members
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Connex, one of Connecticut's largest credit unions, warned tens of thousands of members that unknown attackers had stolen their personal and financial information after breaching its systems in early June. [...]

item.title: How to restore GPT-4o when you've GPT-5
item.dc:creator: Mayank Parmar
item.description: Sam Altman overhyped GPT-5 and the results are underwhelming. Some users are upset with GPT-5's new personality, but you can restore GPT-4o if you pay for the Plus plan. [...]

item.title: Google Calendar invites let researchers hijack Gemini to leak user data
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Google fixed a bug that allowed maliciously crafted Google Calendar invites to remotely take over Gemini agents running on the target's device and leak sensitive user data. [...]

item.title: Google confirms data breach exposed potential Google Ads customers' info
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: Google has confirmed that a recently disclosed data breach of one of its Salesforce CRM instances involved the information of potential Google Ads customers. [...]

item.title: 60 malicious Ruby gems downloaded 275,000 times steal credentials
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Sixty malicious Ruby gems containing credential-stealing code have been downloaded over 275,000 times since March 2023, targeting developer accounts. [...]

item.title: OpenAI to fix GPT-5 issues, double rate limits for paid users after outrage
item.dc:creator: Mayank Parmar
item.description: OpenAI's CEO, Sam Altman, overpromised on GPT-5, and real-life results are underwhelming, but it looks like a new update is rolling out that might address some of the concerns. [...]

item.title: WinRAR zero-day exploited to plant malware on archive extraction
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: A recently fixed WinRAR vulnerability tracked as CVE-2025-8088 was exploited as a zero-day in phishing attacks to install the RomCom malware. [...]

item.title: FTC: Older adults lost record $700 million to scammers in 2024
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Americans aged 60 and older lost a staggering $700 million to online scams in 2024, marking a sharp rise in fraud targeting seniors, according to the Federal Trade Commission. [...]

item.title: U.S. Judiciary confirms breach of court electronic records service
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: The U.S. Federal Judiciary confirms that it suffered a cyberattack on its electronic case management systems hosting confidential court documents and is strengthening cybersecurity measures. [...]
